channel.title: Phishing Site
channel.description:
Well, I know im not a big time poster, but I am really stuck here. I have psoted this on another forum, but they seem to all tell me the same thing. I have scanned with ESet, for rid of some viruses, but didn't stop it. I have updated my windows, and that has not helped it.
What it is, is the homepage of runescape, but the updates are back from when they updated the servers in November. I go to click play runescape, and it tells me to enter username and pass. Then, if I do that, it tells me that my account is under investigation, and that i need to enter my username and bank pin. And if i do that it tells me all the info is incorrect.
can anyone help? (I did use a noob account to get through the thing, to see what it showed) Also, any other link I click on on the page, just takes me to the same thing, so I am unable to report it to Jagex.

item.title: Phishing Site
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Sure. So it’s all fixed?

Read full topic

item.description:
@cheesecake wrote:

Alright, im sorry but I blanked there for a second, and got it.

thank You very much legit, im very glad that you could help me.

Read full topic

item.title: Phishing Site
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

cheesecake:

Ok, look I know your getting mad about this, but im not to good with these things, if you could direct me on how to do that, I would gladly solve my problem. I do not play the computer as much as msot people, so I dont learn all these different things

From legit’s instructions, the only skills you need is knowing how to read.

Read full topic

item.title: Phishing Site
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Just hit WinKey + F, and click All File and Folders. Type in hosts in the top box. Search, there should only be one file named hosts without an extension. Click Open, then select Notepad.

Mine was in C:\WINDOWS\system32\drivers\etc

Can you not read?

Read full topic

item.description:
@cheesecake wrote:

Yea, I saw that, but im asking for help on how to get rid of it, im not too good with computers and all that stuff

Read full topic
